resources.string: CryptoSavior offers a comfortable and secure way to keep files with confidential data encrypted. It uses AES encryption. A MasterKey is used to access the application and to encrypt the files as well.

Confidential files are accessible directly in a list after the login. With one click on the file, an option to open the file with appropriate application is provided along with an option to decrypt as well. The file can be encrypted back after viewing.

The Original file is over-written with random bytes before deletion, after the encryption process is over. As a result, even in case of lost or stolen device, the original file can not be retrieved back with "File Recovery tools".

The MasterKey, as the name suggests is the central key to access the application and encrypt the files as well. It is highly recommended that a longer key is used as a MasterKey and be kept safe. If one forgets the Key, all encrypted files will be lost.
We can ensure the security of CryptoSavior by looking at the following likely scenarios that can happen:
1) The Device is attacked by a malicious app, with rights to read the SD card contents.\n 2)The SD card is lost or stolen.\n 3)The Device is lost or stolen along with the SD card.

If the attacker has access only to the encrypted files(Scenario 1), extreme computing power and ages of time to decrypt the files using brute-force methods. If the attacker has direct access to the SD card or Phone(Scenario 2 and 3), he is required to have root privileges and it is totally dependent on the length of the MasterKey. So it is highly recommended that a lengthy key is used with no compromise for security with regard to comfort.
